item.title: [PI] 317 - Web Slashing HELP - [PI] 317
item.dc:creator: @hi_im_bamf hi im bamf
item.description:
@hi_im_bamf wrote:

The original Web that was already in the game is listed as objectId: 733.
(the one that won’t slash.)

But the Object that WILL slash is also ObjectId: 733

And once you slash the web that doesn’t work, it says it’s been slashed. Very confusing.

Here is a video showing what’s wrong:

Here is my Actionhandler.java

[code=javascript]case 733:
if (c.wearingSharpWeapon()) {
c.startAnimation(c.getCombat().getWepAnim(c.getItems().getItemName(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]).toLowerCase()));
if (Misc.random(1) == 1) {//might make it so they fail less depending on attack level later
//will add a delay timer here so it does not continuously do animation
c.sendMessage(“You slash the web.”);
if (c.objectX == 3158 && c.objectY == 3951) {
new Object(734, c.objectX, c.objectY, c.heightLevel, 1, 10, 733, 50);
} else {
new Object(734, c.objectX, c.objectY, c.heightLevel, 0, 10, 733, 50);//needa fix position of obj 734 at mage arena easy shit tho
}
} else {
//will add a delay timer here later so players can’t mass click it to open
c.sendMessage(“You fail to slash the webs.”);
}
} else if (!c.wearingSharpWeapon()) {
c.sendMessage(“You need a sharp blade to cut the web.”);
}
break;//below is the previous code

	/*case 733:
		c.startAnimation(451);
		if (c.objectX == 3158 && c.objectY == 3951) {
			new Object(734, c.objectX, c.objectY, c.heightLevel, 1, 10, 733, 50);
		} else {
			new Object(734, c.objectX, c.objectY, c.heightLevel, 0, 10, 733, 50);
		}
	break;*/[/code]

Read full topic
